gurmukhi: idsw cwr jIqI iPrXo Pyir bwjI ] gXo bwlmIkM iriKsQwn qwjI ]
transliteration: Deesaa Chaar Jeetiphiryo Pher(i) Baajee|| Gado Baalmeekan Ridhisthaan Taajee||
translation: Wandering in the four direction the horse also reached the hermitage of the sage Valmiki;

gurmukhi: jbY Bwl pqRM lvM Cor bwcXo ] bfo augRDMnXw rsM rudR rwcXo ]731]
transliteration: Jabai Dhaal Patran Lavan Chhodh Baachyo|| Bado Ougradhannyaa Rasan Rudra Raachyo||731||
translation: Where Lava and his companions read the letter written on the head of the horse, they in great fury looked like Rudra.731.

gurmukhi: biRCM bwj bwNDXo lKXo ssqR DwrI ] bfo nwd kY srb sYnw pukwrI ]
transliteration: Brichhan Baaj Baandhyo Llakhyo Sastra Dhdaree|| Bado Naad Kai Sarab Sainaa Poukdaree||
translation: They tied the horse with a tree and the whole army of Shatrughan saw it, the warriors of the army shouted :

gurmukhi: khw jwq ry bwl lIny qurMgM ] qjo nwih Xwko sjo Awn jMgM ]732]
transliteration: Kahaa Jaat Re Baal Leene Turanadg|| Tajo Naah(i) Yaako Sajo Aan Janadg||732||
translation: “O boy ! where are you taking this horse? Either leave it or wage a war with us. “732.

gurmukhi: suxXo nwm ju`DM jbY sRaux sUrM ] mhw ssqR saufI mhwN loh pUrM ]
transliteration: Sounyo Naam Juddhan Jabai Sraoun Sooran||mahaa Sastra Saudimahaan Loh Pooran||
translation: When those weapon-wielders heard the name of war, they showered arrows extensively;

gurmukhi: hTy bIr hwTY sBY ssqR lY kY ] prXo m`iD sYxM bfo nwid kY kY ]733]
transliteration: Hathe Beer Haathai Sabhai Sastra Lai Kai|| Daryo Maddh(i) Sainan Bado Naadh Kai Kai||733||
translation: All the warriors began to fight with persistence, holding their weapons, and here Lava jumped into the army raising a frightening thundering sound.733.

gurmukhi: BlI BwNq mwrY pcwry su sUrM ] igry ju`D joDw rhI DUr pUrM ]
transliteration: Bhalibhaant Mdarai Pachdare Su Sooran|| Gire Juddh Jodhaa Rahidhoor Pooran||
translation: Many warriors were killed, they fell down on the earth and the dust arose on all the four sides;

gurmukhi: auTI ssqR JwrM ApwrMq vIrM ] BRmy ruMf muMf qnM q`C qIrM ]734]
transliteration: Outhisastra Jhaaran Apaarant Vderan|| Bhrame Round Mindan Tanan Tachchh Tderan||734||
translation: The warriors began to shower blows of their weapons and the trunks and heads of the warriors began to fly hither and thither.734.

gurmukhi: igry lu`Q p`QM su ju`Qq bwjI ] BRmY CUC gwQI ibnw suAwr qwjI ]
transliteration: Gire Loutth Patthan Su Joutthant Baajee|| Bhramai Chhodhchh Haathibinaa Suaar Taajee||
translation: The path was filled with the corpses of the horses and the elephants,

gurmukhi: igry ssqR hIxM ibA`sqRMq sUrM ] hsy BUq pRyqM BRmI gYx hUrM ]735]
transliteration: Gire Sastra Heenan Be-asstrant Sooran|| Hase Bhoot Pretan Bhramigadn Hooran||735||
translation: And horses began to run without drivers, the warriors fell being deprived of weapons and the ghosts, fiends and the heavenly damsels began to wander smilingly.735.

gurmukhi: GxM Gor nIswx b`jy ApwrM ] Khy vIr DIrM auTI ssqR JwrM ]
transliteration: Ghanan Ghor Neesan Bajje Apaaran|| Khahe Veer Dhderan Outhisastra Jhaaran||
translation: The trumpets resounded violently, the warriors began to fight and the blows of weapons were showered;

gurmukhi: Cly cwr icqRM bic`qRMq bwxM ] rxM ros r`jy mhwN qyjvwxM ]736]
transliteration: Chale Chaar Chitran Bachittrant Baanan|| Ranan Ros Rajje Mahaan Tevaanan||736||
translation: The arrows were discharged creating wondrous type of paintings and the mighty warriors moved in the battlefield being highly infuriated.736.
The sword arose, seemed, danced and was struck.737.
